author: lgo
msg: Improve the performance of svnsync over ra_serf: step 1.
Add new function replay_range in the ra API (implemented for ra_serf only). This
function can replay multiple revisions and uses callbacks for preparation and
handling of the replay report. Using callbacks enables us to send multiple
replay report requests and handle them asynchronously.
(svn_ra_replay_revstart_callback_t): New callback type, called at start of
(svn_ra_replay_revfinish_callback_t): New callback type, called at finish of
(svn_ra_serf__replay_range): New function, sends requests to replay a
range of revisions and then calls the callbacks while parsing the response.
(start_replay): Calls the revstart callback when encountering the report's
(end_replay): Calls the revfinish callback when encountering the report's
(create_replay_body): New function to share the body creation code between
(open_source_session): Create a second session to the master repo to
(replay_baton_t):N baton, passed around between ra_serf and replay
(replay_rev_started): Replay callback function, opens the sync editor.
(replay_rev_finished): Replay callback function, closes the editor and copies
(do_synchronize): Use the new api svn_ra_replay_range. Update call to

author: lgo
msg: Revert changes from r27538, will be reapplied on the svnsync_ra_serf branch.

author: pburba
msg: Use apr_pcalloc rather than apr_palloc in merge.c where appropriate.
rather than apr_palloc.  This saves us from doing explicit initializations
of members that are NULL or FALSE.
